Federal Register:
129. Folpet (CAS No. 000133-07-3) (CAL) (Ref. 8). Folpet is classified as a Group B2 compound by EPA; i.e., the substance is a probable human carcinogen. Folpet has been shown to induce carcinoma and adenoma of the duodenum in both sexes of CD-1 and B6C3F1 mice. EPA believes that there is sufficient evidence for listing folpet on EPCRA section 313 pursuant to EPCRA section 313(d)(2)(B) based on the available carcinogenicity data for this chemical.

Aquatic acute toxicity test data for folpet include a measured 96-hour LC sub 50 of 39 ppb for rainbow trout, and a measured 96-hour LC sub 50 of 72 ppb (0.072 ppm) for bluegill. EPA believes that there is sufficient evidence for listing folpet on EPCRA section 313 pursuant to EPCRA section 313(d)(2)(C) based on the environmental toxicity data for this chemical.
